<S%G1161>Now<s%> in the <S%G4405>morning<s%> as he <S%G1877>returned<s%> <S%G1519>into<s%> the <S%G4172>city,<s%> he <S%G3983>hungry.<s%>

But <S%G5101>what<s%> <S%G1380>think<s%> you? <S%G191>Hear<s%> <S%G243>another<s%> <S%G3850>parable:<s%> There was a certain <S%G444><s%> <S%G5100><s%> <S%G3617>householder,<s%> <S%G3748>which<s%> <S%G5452>planted<s%> a <S%G290>vineyard,<s%> and hedged <S%G5418><s%> <S%G4060><s%> it round <S%G4060>about,<s%> and <S%G3736>dig<s%> a wine <S%G3025>press<s%> in it, and <S%G3618>built<s%> a <S%G4444>tower,<s%> and <S%G1554>let<s%> it out to <S%G1092>farmers,<s%> and <S%G589>went<s%> <S%G1519>into<s%> a far country: <S%G589><s%>

And <S%G3753>when<s%> the <S%G2540>time<s%> of the <S%G2590>fruit<s%> drew <S%G1448>near,<s%> he <S%G649>sent<s%> his <S%G1401>servants<s%> to the <S%G1092>farmers,<s%> that they might <S%G2983>receive<s%> the <S%G2590>fruits<s%> of it.
